bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 65 (Monday, April 18, 2022)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. MOORE of Alabama:H.R. 7538.=========================== NOTE ===========================April 18, 2022, on p. H4448, right column, the followingappears: By Mr Moore of Alabama: H.R. 7638.The online Record has been corrected to read: By Mr. Moore ofAlabama: H.R. 7538.========================= END NOTE =========================Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 1 of the Constitution of theUnited States.[Page H4448]

item.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H4519)
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

summary.text: This bill reduces the income tax of individual taxpayers for taxable years beginning after December 31, 2021, by the six-month federal income tax holiday amount. That amount is 50% of the income tax otherwise imposed and is phased out based upon taxpayer adjusted gross income.

bill.title: To provide the equivalent of a 6-month Federal income tax holiday for certain individuals.

item.title: To provide the equivalent of a 6-month Federal income tax holiday for certain individuals.
To provide the equivalent of a 6-month Federal income tax holiday for certain individuals.

latestAction.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H4519)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
